intro: Borreria hyssopifolia, commonly known as the Mexican hyssop, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Borreria hyssopifolia is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
